sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A larume belle for London, with à caueat or warning to England also a pitifull complaint of the penitente synner, newlie set forthe by Ihon Carre, citezein of London. Carr, John, citezein of London. Phillippes, W.
[22] p.
By [W. How for] Henry Kirckham, at the signe of the blacke Boie, at the little north doore of Poules, Imprinted at London : 1573.
The Caveat is signed: W. Phillippes. Actual printer's name from STC. Signatures: a b⁴ (-b4). Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[22] p.
By [W. How for] Henry Kirckham, at the signe of the blacke Boie, at the little north doore of Poules, Imprinted at London : 1573.
The Caveat is signed: W. Phillippes. Actual printer's name from STC. Signatures: a b⁴ (-b4). Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
] Henry Kirckham
